dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) You've been hoodwinked.  You've been had.  You've been took. You've been led astray, run amok. You've been bamboozled. His followers ROAR. CUT TO TITLE: "BAMBOOZLED" CUT TO CRAWL: WHITE LETTERS ON BLACK WE HEAR the VOICE of PIERRE DELACROIX.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . INT. HALLWAY - MORNING The writers, beat down, come out of the conference room and move past SLOAN HOPKINS, a highly attractive African- American "sistuh." Delacroix sees Sloan and holds her arm as they walk.  He talks under his breath.

direction.raw_text: . Dunwitty and Delacroix sit on the sofa.
direction.name: direction

OFF-SCREEN, WE HEAR A RUCKUS, A BIG COMMOTION.  VOICES yelling.  Police sirens, cars and trucks. ANGLE ON Apartment.  Cheeba and Manray run to the window and look out. THEIR POV The street is filled with police cars, vans and wagons. Helicopters hover overhead with their searchlights on the building.

direction.raw_text: . INT. DELACROIX'S OFFICE - DAY He sits in front of his TV and watches a tape of the old "Amos 'n' Andy" show.  Sloan leads Manray and Cheeba in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. RESTAURANT - NIGHT A celebration is going on as Delacroix, Sloan, Cheeba and Mantan sit at a table. ANGLE ON Table.  Cheeba and Mantan are giddy.  Sloan looks at Delacroix who is visibly not happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She goes to the ladies' cubicle. CLOSE ON Delacroix.  He leans against the wall. ANGLE ON Bathroom door.  Sloan comes out, grabs him inside. INT. LADIES' ROOM - NIGHT Sloan locks the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE ON Sloan, who's trying to disappear.  If she sits any lower she'll be under her seat. ON DELACROIX DELACROIX We're ready when you are. ON STAGE BIG BLACK Microphone check.  One.  Two.  One. Two.  One.  Two.  Hold up.  I gots to give my peeps some props. Brothers introduce yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The booming track starts and the Mau-Mau's do their thing, bouncing all over the stage.  The lyrics about everything that is BLAK!!! ON DELACROIX A look of disbelief is on his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Dunwitty is out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. SLEEP 'N EAT'S DRESSING ROOM Sleep 'N Eat is also getting dressed.  He wears a worn Pullman Porter uniform with red hat to match. INT. CONTROL ROOM - NIGHT Dunwitty with his black wife in hand, VERNA moves toward Delacroix and Sloan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MANTAN'S DRESSING ROOM Mantan is mashing the corks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WE HEAR THE POUNDING OF THE FEET STOMPING AND THE HANDS CLAPPING. INT. SLEEP 'N EAT'S DRESSING ROOM ON MIRROR Sleep 'N Eat blacks up also.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ON STAGE First Sleep 'N Eat then Mantan shuffles onto the stage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The AUDIENCE is aghast.  Mantan has picked up the pace. He's tapping fast and furious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The WHITE AUDIENCE, of course, has been waiting to see how their black brothers and sisters would react.  Now feeling comfortable and safe, they too being to join the applause. ON AUDIENCE The applause changes into laughter.  It is not nervous laughter we hear, but straight out RIOTOUS LAUGHTER. ON BLACK AND WHITE FACES The laughter is contagious. ON STAGE Mantan starts to move, he's coming back from the dead.  He slowly gets up from his prostate position as he HEARS: A WAYBACK ALABAMA JIG played by the house band, THE PORCH MONKEYS, led by musical director Levi.  Mantan is joined on stage by the other hoofers in the show: JUNGLE BUNNY, SNOWFLAKE, SAMBO, AUNT JEMIMA, RASTUS, NIGGER JIM, plus SLEEP 'N EAT.  Each take turn as it evolves into an elaborate DANCE NUMBER.  The hoofers and the band are also in black face. ON AUDIENCE They are rolling down the aisles. INT. CONTROL ROOM - NIGHT ON DELACROIX Delacroix looks like he has seen a ghost. CLOSER He buries his face in his hands. INT. DELACROIX'S APARTMENT - NEXT NIGHT Delacroix is in the same position as the scene before.  Face buried in his hands. ON PHONE It rings and he picks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. STREETS - NIGHT Dunwitty drives his Mercedes Benz CL 600 Coupe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. I-95 SOUTH - MORNING Delacroix is driving "down south." INT. CAR - CONTINUOUS Delacroix adjusts the mirror so he can see himself.  HE SPEAKS TO US through the MIRROR DELACROIX I figured this was a good time to get away.  Just jump in my ride and go.  I always did my best thinking when I was driving alone.  I needed to think out clearly what I was going to do with this MANTAN - THE NEW MILLENNIUM MINSTREL SHOW. EXT. I-95 SOUTH Delacroix is driving on his way to "Ole Virginny." EXT. MAMA'S SUGAR SHAK - NIGHT Delacroix pulls up in the parking lot of a rinky-kink, funky, greasy BAR/CLUB/BAR-B-Q joint. CLOSE ON NEON SIGN "MAMA'S SUGAR SHAK" - most the letters do not light up, underneath it, "2-NITE - JUNEBUG." INT. MAMA'S SUGAR SHAK It's loud as hell as Delacroix enters this smoky, dark establishment. P.O.V. DELACROIX This must be a big night in here because the PATRONS are dressed to the nines.  What's in style down here is a lot different from what's happening en Nueva York.  Many of the men are dressed like PIMPS from 70's BLAXPLOITATION FILM, the ladies like HOOTCHIE MAMAS from "Luke" video. ON SUGAR SHAK Delacroix works himself through the crowded BAR/DISCO into another small room. ON COMEDY ROOM He walks into a small space where his father JUNEBUG is on the stage. 70. ON JUNEBUG He is a good-looking man, the only speckle of gray in his hair betrays his age.  As he walks around the small stage doing his comedy stylings, he keeps a drink in one hand and sips it often. ON COMEDY ROOM Delacroix sits in the back so his father can't see him. ON DELACROIX He looks around. P.O.V. DELACROIX It's dead in here.  The room is nearly empty. ON TABLE A couple gets loud, arguing over something. ON JUNEBUG JUNEBUG 'Cuse me.  Please.  Can you please show me some respect.  I'm up here trying to make a living.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Junebug gets up from his chair, rushes to his son and they embrace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. SLEEP 'N EAT'S DRESSING ROOM Sleep 'N Eat also begins to black up. INT. STAGE - NIGHT Honeycutt stands in front of the festive young, mixed audience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MANTAN'S DRESSING ROOM Mantan is applying his FIRETRUCK RED lipstick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ON SLOAN She can't believe her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ON CROWD Nothing but butts and breasts gyrating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAWG #2 steps forward also.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. TOYS "R" US Parents are fighting over Beanie Babies.  It's a RUCKUS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CLOSE ON DELACROIX DELACROIX (V.O.) (CONT'D) Mantan was being hailed as groundbreaking, barrier breaking, also earth shaking.  I looked forward to my awards.  Just vindication for all my hard work, all my talent that had been previously overlooked. INT. THEATER - NIGHT Delacroix sits in tux amongst many stars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Woody opens the envelope.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. LIMOUSINE - NIGHT Mantan and Sloan ride in back.  He's still thinking about Cheeba.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. DRESSING ROOM Mantan, face already done, puts on the firetruck red lipstick. INT. APOLLO THEATRE Sloan is looking around this boisterous crowd when she sees ON THE MAU-MAU'S In one of the side boxes. ON BIG BLACK He waves to his sister. ON SLOAN She knows her brother and his clan are up to no good as the house lights go black. ANGLE ON STAGE Honeycutt walks out on stage.  The audience goes crazy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ON MAU-MAU BOX Led by Big Black, they start shouting insults at Mantan. ON STAGE Mantan is a pro, he doesn't stop.  In fact, this makes him dance harder and harder. ON SLOAN She leaves her seat and goes to stop her brother. ON STAGE Mantan is moving and grooving.  The unrest in the audience has picked up. ON AUDIENCE They start to "boo."  The tide has turned.  Encouraged, the Mau-Mau's pick it up another notch. ON MANTAN He's human after all, and he does hear the boos.  Don't let those athletes in the papers fool you.  You hear the boos and nobody, nobody except Dennis Rodman likes to be booed. Mantan is getting rattled. ON MAU-MAU'S BOX Sloan rushes into the box and they are quiet.  They don't have to say or shout a thing.  The rough Apollo crowd is doing it all themselves. TWO SHOT ON SLOAN AND BIG BLACK The sister and big brother look at each other.  There is no love between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ON MAU-MAU'S BOX Mantan, led by Honeycutt, runs for his life. ON MOB They chase him. ON BACKSTAGE DOOR Mantan is hauling ass. EXT. BACKSTAGE The door crashes open, Mantan rockets out into an open car door. ON CAR DOOR The door slams. EXT. STREET - NIGHT The car spins away. INT. CAR - NIGHT Delacroix is behind the wheel.  This is the most shaken we've seen Mantan to date.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. DELACROIX'S OFFICE - NIGHT SLOAN That was a mistake, but I don't regret it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. SLOAN'S STUDIO APARTMENT - DAY Mantan is grilling Sloan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Delacroix does this several times.  CLOSEUPS of the BLACK COLLECTIBLES in the office. CLOSER ON JNB Delacroix is staring at the JNB when its MOUTH OPENS, a quarter flies in and its EYES roll to the top of its HEAD. ON DELACROIX He is incredulous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. MANTAN'S DRESSING ROOM - NIGHT Mantan looks up at his makeup laid out before him on the counter. TIGHT ON MANTAN He stares at himself in the dressing room mirror.  Mantan can't stand to BLACK UP anymore. INT. STAGE - NIGHT Honeycutt stands next to a young black couple TRE and STACY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. BACKSTAGE The security guards toss Manray out the stage door.  Manray looks down the alley and it's empty except for a parked SUV. He picks himself up and does a joyous dance.  This is Manray's dance of Freedom. ON STREET The Big Black Chevy Suburban creeps down the alley to a dancing Manray and comes to rest right in front of him. Manray tries to shield his eyes from the hi-beam headlights.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. X-FORCE WAR ROOM - NIGHT There is a flurry of activity - people man phones, computers all HI-TECH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . INT. CNS STUDIO ON DUNWITTY DUNWITTY Help us and in addition you will get a guest-starring speaking role on the next Mantan - The New Millennium Minstrel Show, plus an added bonus: a lifetime of Da Bomb
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ON MONITOR DELACROIX (V.O.) (CONT'D) Since a lot of people still didn't have computers, the networks sought a court order to carry it live, taking the feed off the internet. It was granted.  A life snuff broadcast right into your living room. ON DELACROIX DELACROIX (V.O.) (CONT'D) I had to give it to the Mau-Mau', they definitely had a sense of irony.  They chose www.nigger.com as the website to pirate. INT. FACTORY - NIGHT The Mau-Mau's ironically wear WHITE MASKS, they stand behind the tied-up Mantan.  A device alters their voices.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ON COMPUTER SCREEN We see a CARTOON, Yosemite Sam is shooting at the feet of Bugs Bunny with his six-shooter in each hand.  Bugs Bunny is doing a fast dance, dodging bullets. ON MONITOR The Mau-Mau's shoot at the feet of Manray.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ON DELACROIX His head pops up as he sees the objects.  He too is in BLACKFACE.  In a rage, he starts to throw them against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She points the gun at his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ON DELACROIX He looks at the monitor, the tape still playing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Satire.  1a.  A literary work in which human vice or folly is ridiculed or attacked scornfully. B.  The branch of literature that composes such work.  2.  Irony, derision or caustic wit used to attack or expose folly, vice or stupidity. INT. APARTMENT - MORNING WE are in the living quarters of PIERRE DELACROIX.  The windows overlook the Brooklyn Promenade and the majestic lower Manhattan skyline.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Bonjour, my name is Pierre Delacroix. I'm a television writer, also a showrunner, a creative person. We see a tall figure move in and around the space.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) I'm one of those people responsible for what you view on your idiot box. CLOSE ON Monogrammed cuff sleeve - the initials P.D.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) The problem is not enough of you have been watching. CLOSE ON Monogrammed shirt pocket - the initials P.D.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) With the onslaught of the internet, video and interactive games, nine hundred channels to choose from and whatnot, our valued audience has dramatically eroded. CLOSE ON Razor cuts a path through a white foam on a black face.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) To put it in much more simple terms... Delacroix YELLS.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) Like rats fleeing a sinking ship. CLOSE ON The handsome face of Pierre Delacroix.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) People tuning out by the millions. Delacroix turns to the CAMERA and addresses US.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Which is not good. EXT. TENEMENT - LOWER EAST SIDE - MORNING The tenement building is boarded up, condemned, bombed out, but a home, a shelter nonetheless. INT. TENEMENT - MORNING People to our surprise live in here.  It is a commune.  The homeless, people who have been left out, forgot about, written off, and don't matter.  The fringes of society. CHEEBA, a skinny Puerto Rican male, tries to wake a slumbering body under a mass of old newspapers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yo, let's get to it.  You don't dance, we don't eat.  Simple as that. The mass begins to move.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's right.  We slow.  We blow. We snooze.  We lose. INT. CNS TOWER - MORNING MANRAY, a young African-American dread-lock male, and Cheeba are getting set up in front of the entrance to the CONTINENTAL NETWORK SYSTEM building.  CNS is one of the fledgling, upstart new networks, trying to battle with ABC, NBC, CBS, FOX, WB, and UPN. ANGLE ON Entrance.  Cheeba is putting the portable floor down on the sidewalk.  Manray sits on the curb, taking the sneakers off and putting on his tap shoes; bottle caps are on the soles of the shoes instead of real taps.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good morning, ladies and gentlemen. I know everybody is in a hurry to work, ready to begin another day in this rat race.  But don't sleep us. I'm Cheeba and I introduce to you the world renown MANRAY, the man with the educated feet. Manray takes a small bow.  A few, not many, people have stopped to look.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As we continue our world wind tour, we would like to give you a little somethin', somethin' before you go off to make that money.  I give you Manray. CLOSE ON Manray, who starts to do his thing, and when he starts doing his thing attention must be paid. ANGLE ON Crowd, as Manray gets busy, people gather to watch. ANGLE ON 4. Delacroix, he is about to walk into the CNS building but stops to check out Manray. CLOSE ON Manray, he pounds out some intricate steps and freezes at the end of the move. ANGLE ON Crowd, who applaud as Cheeba unfolds a brown shopping bag and holds it out in front of them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you very much but please don't go without giving us some cheddar, cheese, money.  We prefer two's than fews. People are digging into their pockets.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I would like to add that both of us are homeless.  Not that it means anything. A WOMAN is about to dump some change in the brown paper bag.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I said homeless.  Ladies and gentlemen.  Senorita, do you know what that means? Cheeba looks at her and she quickly pulls out a 5-spot from her purse and drops it into the bag.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Muchos gracias. Cheeba works his way over to Delacroix.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good morning, Cheeba.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good morning to you, Mr. Delapot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: De-la-croix.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Y'know what I mean.  Got a gig yet for Manray and I yet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not yet. Delacroix hands Cheeba a ten dollar bill.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gracias. Delacroix moves towards the revolving doors of CNS.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Manray, Sloan says you're too talented to be dancing on the street.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well do something about it. INT. ELEVATOR - MORNING Delacroix is the lone person of color in the elevator. INT. CNS - MORNING Delacroix gets off the elevator, takes out his ID, slips it through the scanner and enters the reception area of CNS.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good morning, Marie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's not gonna be a good morning for you if you don't get into Dunwitty's staff meeting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What staff meeting?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The staff meeting that started 30 minutes ago. INT. CONFERENCE ROOM - MORNING Delacroix walks, or better yet, slithers into the staff meeting that is already in progress.  TWENTY WRITERS sit around an oval table, all are Caucasian except Delacroix, again he's the lone person of color, the "fly in the buttermilk." DUNWITTY, Senior V.P. of the Entertainment Division of CNS looks at Delacroix and waits for him to sit down before he continues.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Monsieur Delacroix, this very important meeting commenced... Dunwitty looks at his Rolex Chronograph - Daytona Model.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...exactly thirty-two minutes ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry I'm late.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you know how much information can be dispensed in one minute alone?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't find out about this very important staff meeting until... Delacroix looks at his Jaeger-LeCoultre.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Four minutes ago.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So are you telling me everyone knew about this get-together except you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wasn't told about this until Marie informed me as soon as I got off the elevator. All eyes are on Delacroix and he feels it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: People, you can attempt to pull a Rodman like our friend Delacroix, but I guarantee you'll be sent packing just like him. Dunwitty via remote turns off the lights and turns on an overhead projector.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: These are the standings.  Read 'em and weep.  As you can plainly see the Continental Network System is languishing. CLOSE ON Ratings charts.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (CONT'D) Look at 'em people.  We are BOOTY, CA CA.  We are DOO-DOO.  Doo-doo on a stick, if you will. CLOSE ON Dunwitty.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I do not like to be the laughing stock of the broadcast industry.  I have pride and people, you better start getting some too.  These numbers have to go up. Dunwitty turns on the lights.  JOAN, one of the writers, raises her hand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Question?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So what do you want us to do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What I want everyone to do is write some material that is FUNNY.  The junk you've been writing is about as funny as a dead baby.  It's not funny, it's not new.  It's not sexy. It, it, it... CLOSE ON Fish.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sucks. ANGLE ON Conference room.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: .  Thank you, Fish.  This meeting is over but I want everyone to seriously think about what I said and how you can deliver. People scurry out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Monsieur Delacroix, in my office now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How was it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why didn't you tell me about this staff meeting?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nobody told me anything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What good are you if you don't tell me stuff like this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It wasn't my fault.  If I would have known, I would have known. INT. DUNWITTY'S OFFICE - MORNING Delacroix enters his corner office, which has huge action photos of ALI, JORDAN, GRIFFEY, TYSON, AARON and JABBAR on his walls, it is also decorated with African art throughout. ANGLE ON Office.  Dunwitty looks at the floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking mid-town Manhattan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you know what C.P. Time is?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: .P. Time is Colored People's Time. The stereotypical belief that Negroes are always late.  That Negroes have no sense of time - time except when it comes to music or dance. They both laugh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's sit down over there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry about my blowup but I have to have a whipping boy every meeting.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I understand.  But again, in all honesty I was not informed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forget it.  I believe you're my most creative person I've got on staff.  You're hip.  You know what's happening.  I got some corny white boys and girls writing for me. Delacroix doesn't join him in his laughter because he doesn't know how to take that comment or where Dunwitty is headed with it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I understand Black culture.  I grew up around black people all my life. If the truth be told I probably know "niggers" better than you, Monsieur Delacroix.  Please don't get offended by my use of the quote-unquote N word.  I got a black wife and three bi-racial children, so I feel I have a right to use that word.  I don't give a damn what Spike says, Tarantino is right.  Nigger is just a word.  If Dirty Ole Bastard can use it every other word so can I.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I would prefer you not use that word in my presence.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: .  NIGGER.  NIGGER.  NIGGER. Delacroix pounces on top of Dunwitty like a cat on a mouse and gives him a quick BROOKLYN BEAT DOWN.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Say it again.  C'mon, say it again. CLOSE ON Dunwitty.  He's a bloody pulp.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who's a nigger now? POW.  This is a fantasy in Delacroix's mind.  We go BACK TO REALITY.  Everything's how we left it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The material you've been creating is too white bread.  White people with black faces.  The Huxtable's, Cosby, revolutionary.  But that's dead.  We can't go down that road again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't agree.  The Negro middle class does exist, and it's rich material for a dramatic series or sitcom.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm telling you it's not. He goes to his desk, picks up Delacroix's scripts and starts throwing them one by one against the window.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The middle class black family moves into a white suburban enclave.  The middle class black family moves into a small Southern town that is run by the KKK.  The middle class single black father raises his teenage daughter.  The middle class single black father raises his teenage daughter.  The middle class single black mother raises her teenage son.  And so on and so forth.  It's too clean, too antiseptic...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...to white?  I still feel all of my scripts would make good shows.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Delacroix, wake up, brother man. The reason why they didn't get picked up was because nobody - and I mean NOBODY - niggers and crackers alike wants to see that junk.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've never been given a fair shot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got your head stuck up your ass with your Harvard education and your pretentious ways.  Brother man, I'm blacker than you.  I'm keepin' it real and you're frontin', trying to be white.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: HOMEBOYS FROM OUT OF SPACE, SECRET DIARY OF DESMOND PFEIFFER, A

dialogue.raw_text: I'm an oreo, a sell out?  Because I don't aspire to do HOMEBOYS FROM OUT OF SPACE, SECRET DIARY OF DESMOND PFEIFFER, A PJ's or some as you might put it, some "nigger" show?  I'm a Tom?  I'm whiter than white and you're blacker than black? Is that what you think?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's exactly what I think.  I want you to create something that people want to see.  Let's be honest, the majority of the people in the country are deaf, dumb and blind and I'm including 35 million African-Americans.  You know and I know "niggers" set the trend, set the styles.  This is a golden opportunity now.  These idiots have to be led to the water.
dialogue.name: dialogue

Soon after dis my wife gave birth to a son, which of course was my father's brother in-law and my uncle, for he was the brother of my step-mother.  My father's wife also became the mother of a son.  He was of course my brother and also my grandchild for he was the son of my daughter.  Accordingly, my wife was my grandmother because she was my mother's mother. (MORE)
